alert.note: Alert for Colorado Springs Vicinity, Southern El Paso County, Rampart Range Below 7400 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 21 at 2:13PM MDT until June 22 at 3:06PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Pueblo CO has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Colorado... Fountain Creek Near Pinon affecting Pueblo Vicinity Fountain Creek Near Fountain affecting Colorado Springs Vicinity/Southern El Paso County Fountain Creek At Colorado Springs affecting Colorado Springs Vicinity/Southern El Paso County For the Fountain Creek...including Colorado Springs, Fountain, Pinon...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Fountain Creek At Colorado Springs. * WHEN...From this evening to tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Homeless encampment below and near the Nevada Avenue bridge is affected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:45 PM MDT Wednesday the stage was 5.9 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached late this evening. - Flood stage is 11.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Rapidly rising creek levels and swift flowing water pose a significant hazard to those near waterways even below flood stage levels. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/pub. The next statement will be issued this evening around 7 PM MDT.

area.areaDesc: Colorado Springs Vicinity, Southern El Paso County, Rampart Range Below 7400 Ft
